alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:12AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF DELAWARE COUNTY THROUGH 245 AM EDT... At 211 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Delaware, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Westerville, Delaware, Powell, Sunbury, Polaris, Radnor, Galena, Alum Creek State Park, Olive Green, Stratford, Warrensburg, Center Village, Leonardsburg, Kilbourne and Lewis Center. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 122 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
